author: COMSOL
description: A Gaussian beam is launched into a BK-7 optical glass. The material has an intensity-dependent refractive index. For the center of the beam, the refractive index is the largest. This induced refractive index profile counteracts the diffractive effects and actually focuses the beam. Thereby the name self-focusing. Self-focusing is important in design of high-power laser systems. The model demonstrates 3D nonlinear wave propagation.
label: self_focusing.mph
name: root
